name: Megaro Hotel

reviews.text: The Megaro's a nice, small-ish boutique-style hotel. Very nice rooms, great staff, SUPER comfortable mattress (easily the most comfortable I've ever had in a hotel).
reviews.title: London is always expensive, this one's worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their price (at this level of quality) beat almost everybody else. At the same time, their location's fantastic: It's right opposite both King's Cross and St Pancras International railway stations, which also means access to several tube lines, including the Piccadilly line, which will take you to the most famous spots in the general direction of Buckingham palace. (Especially important to me: Russell Square/Holborn stations are on that line as well - I love the British Museum.)
reviews.title: Handy location

reviews.text: No need to say that coming in from Luton or Gatwick, these two stations sound pretty good as well. Heathrow as well, of course, as the Piccadilly line will get you there also.
reviews.title: Good Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: If you do some more reading here, you'll come across comments on the Megaro's air conditioning system. This is a bit of an issue. In our room (404) there was a tipping point: Below 26°C the room would get cold, and above it would get really hot. It takes a night, but you'll get used to it :) Also, they can adjust the thing a little from downstairs, so you can ask for help at reception as well.
reviews.title: A great little boutique hotel

reviews.text: Their in-house restaurant, Karpo, isn't anything I'd recommend though. Bossy personnel, and the driest Cumberland sausage sandwich I've had in my life. (A good cappuccino though, if you're into breakfast coffees.)
reviews.title: Little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in the apartments kind of behind the hotel but owned by Hotel Megaro. It was wonderful. It is an excellent location for those taking the train to Paris as it is almost across the street. It is clean and staff is great. We loved it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
On the right tracks
reviews.text: This a fantastically friendly and convenient hotel the room was lovely A hotel room with three windows special! The coffee and tea first rate never under estimate good coffee. Bathroom good I thought the pillows to soft.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We pre-paid for this hotel and were guaranteed a Executive room with king bed (my husband is tall), and quiet side. We got a double bed on the noisy side. Had to take the mattress off the bed so my husband didn't have to sleep curled up.
reviews.title: Didn't get what we paid for

reviews.text: The first night our room was extremely hot. The temperature has to be adjusted by staff. That was what we were told for two nights. Third day I was told we could adjust it in our room.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not impressed and we cancelled our return stay here for later in the month.
reviews.title: Extremely comfortable place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is across the street from St. Pancras rail station where we took the Eurostar early next day to Brussels. The hotel is quiet, clean, quite comfortable and stylishly decorated, but one of the best things is its adjoining restaurant, "Karpo." It is a real convenience and treat to have an excellent restaurant in your hotel, and our dinner of homemade pasta was terrific. We'd go back in a second.
reviews.title: "Perfect location for Eurostar travel"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Megaro for our 2 night stay in London.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was in a great location, the entrance to the tube was just outside the hotel which is great for exploring London.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had been upgraded to a Superior Double room which was very spacious, modern and clean.
reviews.title: Great hotel,great location for Eurostar

reviews.text: Only gripe was the room was a little noisey but this is due to the works at Kings Cross but not the hotels fault.
reviews.title: Great location, good if you're visiting from the US

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tucked away just around the corner from King's Cross/St. Pancras the hotel is ideally situated for users of those stations. It was great to be able to get off the train and check in without having to struggle on and off the tube with luggage. Staff are polite and friendly, rooms are clean and spacious, and our bathroom had a multi-jet shower.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had great American pancakes with maple syrup for breakfast in the adjoining restaurant.
reviews.title: Good, Not Great

reviews.text: Recommended!
reviews.title: Great hotel, clean and modern
St Pancras Stop Over
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in an Executive Double. The room was clean and spacious. The only downside to the room was that it too warm so you had to open the windows. This made it tough to sleep due to the high level of noise outside.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They claim to have W-Fi but it didn't work.
reviews.title: Brilliant location

description: The hotel boasts 49 comfortable en suite rooms, many of which overlook the impressive exterior of St. Pancras station. All of the stylish and contemporary rooms have unique furnishings and bespoke fittings.
